data.title: Make scatter-command more useful
data.body:
Perhaps the scatter-command could be made more useful, so troops/vehicles try to spread apart in opposite directions, instead of each of em just taking a random direction.
So there would be more space between them.

Would be especially useful for exploding units like grenadiers, arties and others.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1338805-make-scatter-command-more-useful?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Deploying MCV no longer works while in motion

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
No matter if you use the hotkey or right click it:
When the MCV is still in motion, you cannot deploy it.
It has to stop first or you have to stop it with the stop-hotkey.

Worked in last release (20130915).

data.title: Infantry death sounds should be consistent with infdeaths
data.body: eg in RA only dedman10.aud should play when infantry units get hit by a flame tower, not a random death sound. We're already being consistent with death animations, we need to be consistent with sounds.

data.title: [Feedback/Review] Playtest 20131130
data.body:
After having a look at the playtest, I decided to give some feedback.

My 2 cents:

1) The **mad tank is not useful at the current configuration**, as it is hardly worth the 2500 ore + 1 minute production time. It either needs a longer time operation (and thus more damage to buildings and units). 

Other uses of the mad Tank: 
-- Destroy walls
-- destroy ore (but not the ore mine)

2) Not sure if this is a feature or bug: **My own units kept dying on my mines**. I played allies. I liked it, as it made mines a double edged sword. Just mentioning it here, in case it is a bug. #3513

3) **The build radius is a excellent improvement**. It will make base walking much more cost intensive. 

4) **The change to give E3 a speed boost has greatly affected their use in a positive way** - finally one can use them next to E1s in offensive operations.

data.title: SpriteReader fixes

Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5472
Exception of type `System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException`: Den angitte nøkkelen finnes ikke i ordlisten.
   ved System.ThrowHelper.ThrowKeyNotFoundException()
   ved System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.get_Item(TKey key)

   ved System.Threading.ThreadHelper.ThreadStart()
Red Alert Mod at Version playtest-20131130
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5472
Exception of type `System.AccessViolationException`: Forsøk på lesing fra eller skriving til beskyttet minne. Dette er ofte en indikasjon på at annet minne er ødelagt.
   ved Tao.Sdl.Sdl.SDL_GL_SwapBuffers()
   ved OpenRA.Renderer.SdlCommon.SdlGraphics.Present()

   ved OpenRA.Game.Run()
   ved OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   ved OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
I guess its a bad map, like : "name your map here"

data.title: Crash (Out of sync)
data.body:
Hi,

After about 20 minutes of online play with 5 other players on the map 1v6 my game crashed.
I play on Windows 8.1 Pro x64, OpenRA release-20130915.
All log files uploaded to http://xvq04q.1fichier.com/Logs.rar (because some logs ar big : debug.log 71 Mb, perf.log 1Mb, syncreport.log 3 Mb).

![sans titre](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6080500/1651309/6f424ea4-5ad0-11e3-939f-3b14cefd2e17.png)

[exception.log]
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Out of sync in frame 12753: Blame Tick.
 Compare syncreport.log with other players.
   à OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.OutOfSync(Int32 frame, String blame)
   à OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.CheckSync(Byte[] packet)
   à OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.<TickImmediate>c__AnonStorey14.<>m__4(Int32 clientId, Byte[] packet)
   à OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.<Receive>c__AnonStorey1C.<>m__17(Int32 client, Byte[] data)
   à OpenRA.Network.EchoConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn)
   à OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn)
   à OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate()
   à OpenRA.Sync.<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey36.<>m__72()
   à OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn)
   à OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged(World world, Action fn)
   à OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   à OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager, Viewport viewPort)
   à OpenRA.Game.Run()
   à OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   à OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: [Idea] Moving Lua functions around

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Mission.PerformHelicopterInsertion and Mission.PerformHelicopterExtraction are (quite obviously) inside of the generic mission.lua but are very specific to allies-01-classic and I feel they would be better inside of that script instead of the generic one.

Unless I am missing something (which is quite possible) I see no reason for specific functions like those to go inside of the generic mission.lua.

The allies-02-classic has reinforcement functions in its own lua and this seems to make the most sense to me.

EDIT:
@chrisforbes and I discussed this in IRC and it seems the way it is already setup makes the most sense, with more of the reinforce functions moving into the generic `mission.lua` and out of the specific mission scripts.

data.body: Takes advantage of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4185. Adds a test case for https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/isometric as the new SHP(TS) placeholder tile is isometric.

data.title: Write a tutorial on creating a basic mod.
data.body:
This should cover creating a new mod.yaml that inherits an existing mod (including, instead of copying the base files).
It should then demostrate how to add a new unit that uses already existing graphics (changing the Image key in Render*), and overriding properties on an existing unit.

data.title: Utility requires --minimap to generate small compressed bitmaps of map files
System.NullReferenceException: OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer
data.body:
So I just recently installed OpenRA playtest- 20131112.

I just click on the icon to start the thing up and after a little while, expecting OpenRA to start up but all I get is crashing and Windows asking me to send an Error Report.
I use Windows XP SP3.

This is the entire contents of the exception.log (There wasn't anything else):

Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 5.1.2600 Service Pack 3)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.3649
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer..ctor()
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 5.1.2600 Service Pack 3)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.3649
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at OpenRA.Program.FatalError(Exception e)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

Hope you can fix. Good luck :)))
